item.title: Ukraine-Russia war LIVE – Evil Putin VIOLATES ceasefire leaving wounded ‘dying in agony’ at Mariupol steelworks
item.dc:creator: Louis Allwood
item.description: VLADIMIR Putin has VIOLATED ceasefires leaving Ukrainian wounded soldiers ‘dying in agony’, a Ukrainian commander has said. The Deputy Ukrainian commander has also accused the Russian troops of preventing evacuations of civilians from the Mariupol steelworks. In a video posted on Telegram, Capt Sviatoslav Palamar said: “It’s day three since the enemy entered the Azovstal factory, where […]
item.content:encoded:
VLADIMIR Putin has VIOLATED ceasefires leaving Ukrainian wounded soldiers ‘dying in agony’, a Ukrainian commander has said.

The Deputy Ukrainian commander has also accused the Russian troops of preventing evacuations of civilians from the Mariupol steelworks.

In a video posted on Telegram, Capt Sviatoslav Palamar said: “It’s day three since the enemy entered the Azovstal factory, where heavy, bloody fighting continues”.

“Yet again, the Russians have broken their promises of a ceasefire and did not allow the evacuation of civilians who continue to shelter from the shelling in the factory’s basements.

“Our enemy observes no ethical norms, conventions or laws”.

The news comes as, Putin’s forces have practised nuclear missile strikes and chemical attacks in chilling war games on NATO’s border.

Moscow confirmed its troops ran simulated nuclear missile strikes in the western enclave of Kaliningrad on Wednesday amid heightening tensions over the war in Ukraine.

The announcement came on the 70th day of Mad Vlad‘s blundering invasion of Ukraine which has seen thousands killed and more than 13 million displaced in the worst refugee crisis in Europe since World War Two.

Follow our Russia-Ukraine live blog below for up-to-the-minute updates…

item.title: Russian soldiers taunt fleeing women by threatening to murder husbands & send them their heads in a box
item.dc:creator: Adam Sonin
item.description: RUSSIAN soldiers taunted women fleeing the horror of bomb-blitzed Mariupol by threatening to murder their husbands and send them their heads in a box. Some of the wives and girlfriends of the city’s heroic defenders escaped from the Azovstal “Alamo” on a UN and Red Cross mercy mission. But they were stopped and ordered to […]
item.content:encoded:
RUSSIAN soldiers taunted women fleeing the horror of bomb-blitzed Mariupol by threatening to murder their husbands and send them their heads in a box.

Some of the wives and girlfriends of the city’s heroic defenders escaped from the Azovstal “Alamo” on a UN and Red Cross mercy mission.

Russian soldiers taunted women fleeing Mariupol by threatening to murder their husbands and send them their heads in a box[/caption]

But they were stopped and ordered to strip at multiple checkpoints where Russian troops hurled abuse, one told news website Ukrainian Pravda.

Katia, who escaped with two children, said: “Women who had acquaintances serving in the Ukrainian military or the police were threatened.

“They were promised that they would be sent their husband’s head in a box.

“We were undressed, any scars and tattoos were checked, and women’s underpants were searched.”

Read More on Ukraine war

FINAL STAND

Evil Putin VIOLATES ceasefire leaving Ukrainian wounded 'dying in agony'

READY FOR WAR

Meet hero boxers fighting on Ukraine front line against Russia including Usyk

Meanwhile, the besieged Azovstal steel plant’s last defenders appealed to their chain of command to get wounded comrades to safety.

Russian invaders were said to have breached the perimeter following a devastating air, land and sea bombardment.

The Kremlin denied it was an attempt to storm the plant, saying the bombings were to prevent the defenders moving to new positions.

Elsewhere, Ukraine troops launched counter attacks around Kharkiv and the city of Izyum where Russians are trying to build up forces.

Help those fleeing conflict with The Sun’s Ukraine Fund

PICTURES of women and children fleeing the horror of Ukraine’s devastated towns and cities have moved Sun readers to tears.

Many of you want to help the five million caught in the chaos — and now you can, by donating to The Sun’s Ukraine Fund.

Give as little as £3 or as much as you can afford and every penny will be donated to the Red Cross on the ground helping women, children, the old, the infirm and the wounded.

Donate here to help The Sun’s fund

Or text to 70141 from UK mobiles

£3 — text SUN£3
£5 — text SUN£5
£10 — text SUN£10

Texts cost your chosen donation amount (e.g. £5) +1 standard message (we receive 100%). For full T&Cs visit redcross.org.uk/mobile

The Ukraine Crisis Appeal will support people in areas currently affected and those potentially affected in the future by the crisis.

In the unlikely event that the British Red Cross raise more money than can be reasonably and efficiently spent, any surplus funds will be used to help them prepare for and respond to other humanitarian disasters anywhere in the world.

For more information visit https://donate.redcross.org.uk/appeal/disaster-fund

item.title: Russian hackers threaten to shut down UK hospital ventilators after ‘member of their cyber crime gang’ arrested in UK
item.dc:creator: Laura Goddard
item.description: RUSSIAN hackers have threatened to shut down British hospital ventilators after an alleged member of their cyber crime gang was arrested in the UK. A Putin cheerleader based in London was held after a police raid on Monday, following a high-tech assault on government websites in Romania. His alleged comrades from the sinister Russian group […]
item.content:encoded:
RUSSIAN hackers have threatened to shut down British hospital ventilators after an alleged member of their cyber crime gang was arrested in the UK.

A Putin cheerleader based in London was held after a police raid on Monday, following a high-tech assault on government websites in Romania.

Russian hackers have threatened to destroy life-saving British hospital ventilators after an alleged member of their gang was arrested in the UK[/caption]

His alleged comrades from the sinister Russian group Killnet last night warned they would disable life-saving ventilators across the UK if he is not released.

The suspect has previously crowed of his support for Russia’s invasion of Ukraine in Facebook posts emblazoned with Russian flags and the letter “Z”, the invasion symbol daubed on Russian tanks.

National Crime Agency cops and officers flown in from Romania swooped on an address in London for the raid.

The Putin fan was arrested under suspicion of assisting Killnet’s attacks, which were staged earlier this week on the Romanian government and media in retribution for supporting Ukraine in the conflict.

Killnet claimed responsibility for the hacks, which jammed the official government webpage and the defence ministry. Political parties, cultural organisations and companies were also targeted.

Read More on Russia

FINAL STAND

Evil Putin VIOLATES ceasefire leaving Ukrainian wounded 'dying in agony'

SCORCHED EARTH

Humiliated Putin is running out of MISSILES in war on Ukraine, say UK chief

The group’s leaders went online to claim the arrested suspect had nothing to do with their action — but threatened to target NHS ventilators if he was not released within 48 hours.

Cyber crime sources close to the investigation warned last night that the threat was credible.

Most read in News

HIGH BRAWL

PILOT FREAKout

Passengers terrified as untrained pilot forced to turn back mid-flight

The warning, posted on the Telegram messaging site, threatened: “If he is not released within 48 hours I will destroy your Romania, Great Britain and Moldova.

“I will destroy your entire information structure and even your Ministry of Health.

‘Appropriate response’

“All ventilators will be attacked. Only then will you begin to realise the mistake you have made.”

The rant, from the group’s leader, was signed off with a black heart emoji beside a Russian flag.

The suspect had already been released under investigation when the threat was posted, but it is believed the group could carry out an attack if the case is pursued.

Analysts fear life-threatening cyber attacks by Russian tech terrorists could help trigger World War Three.

Thousands of ventilators in hospitals across the UK still remain vital in the battle to keep seriously ill Covid patients alive.

If Killnet’s links to the Russian state are proven, the attack against Romania or any action against the UK could technically trigger a Nato military response.

Read More on The Sun

CHELLE'S PAIN

Michelle Heaton in tears on Loose Women over rehab letter from husband

SKY DRAMA

RAF jets escorting plane over London sparks panic - but there's an explanation

UK Government cybercrime experts accept hospital systems are vulnerable to such attacks, but insist they remain vigilant.

A source told The Sun last night: “The UK has robust cyber security measures in place and, working with partners, the NCA would lead an appropriate response to any cyber crime incident having a significant impact on the UK.”

The alleged hacker was arrested under suspicion of assisting Killnet’s attacks, which were staged earlier this week on the Romanian government[/caption]

item.title: Is Robyn Curnow leaving CNN International?
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Roback
item.description: ROBYN Curnow made a name for herself as a member of the CNN staff. In May 2022, she updated fans on her career and revealed a shocking change. Is Robyn Curnow leaving CNN International? On May 3, 2022, Curnow took to Instagram, where she released a statement about her career. In the statement, she revealed […]
item.content:encoded:
ROBYN Curnow made a name for herself as a member of the CNN staff.

In May 2022, she updated fans on her career and revealed a shocking change.

Robyn Curnow is a South African journalist[/caption]

Is Robyn Curnow leaving CNN International?

On May 3, 2022, Curnow took to Instagram, where she released a statement about her career.

In the statement, she revealed that she would be leaving CNN after two decades on television.

“So, yes, I’m walking away,” she wrote. “20 years as #CNN [correspondent] and anchor. And I’ve decided it’s time to change. This is my decision.

Read More on The US Sun

LIFELONG MIRACLE

What to know about CNN correspondent Richard Rot?

ANCHORMAN

Meet CNN anchor Boris Sanchez

“I’m excited for the plans I’ve been cooking up recently,” she continued.

“Mostly, at this moment when I reflect on my career, I feel profound thanks to all my CNN colleagues and friends around the world.”

“…God, it’s been fun. XxxxR,” she concluded.

At this time, it remains unclear what Curnow will do in the future.

Most read in World News

FINAL STAND

Evil Putin VIOLATES ceasefire leaving Ukrainian wounded 'dying in agony'

VLAD'S NHS PLOT

Russian cyber gang vows to cripple UK ventilators after 'hacker' arrest

SCORCHED EARTH

Humiliated Putin is running out of MISSILES in war on Ukraine, say UK chief

RESORT TRAGEDY

Ayia Napa Brit, 26, 'killed mum driving beach buggy high on drink & drugs'

NUKE THREAT

Putin practises NUCLEAR missile strikes in chilling war games on Nato border

LED BY JACKALS

Putin threw us into war like dogs with no training - we've been betrayed

What have people said about Robyn Curnow leaving?

Along with posting a statement on Instagram, Curnow also wrote one on Twitter.

After her post, several fans and colleagues took to the comments section, where they congratulated her on her new adventure.

“Watched you for the longest time possible. Loved you all the way. Best of luck on your new chapter. You will be dearly missed esp from me watching in Uganda,” one fan wrote.

Another wrote, “Well done, Ms Robyn! You did us and yourself and CNN proud! Fly high and fast to whatever awaits and let us know where you are and whatchadoowin’ next!”

Robyn Curnow announced she was leaving CNN in May 2022[/caption]

CNN Correspondent Dianne Gallagher also commented, writing: “You’re incredible. While I am sad you won’t be with us anymore, I can’t wait to see what your next move will be. Thank you for everything you brought to CNN.”

Piers Morgan added, “Congrats on a great run, Robyn.”

Who is Robyn Curnow?

Curnow is known as a South African journalist and news anchor who first joined CNN in July 2002.

Her career began at SABC in 1995 following her graduation from the University of KwaZulu-Natal, where she obtained a bachelor’s degree in Political Science and Government, according to her Linkedin profile.

Read More On The Sun

LAST WORDS

Harrowing final message of former Miss USA reveals chilling way she timed text

MAD MOMMA

Kourtney SLAMS mom Kris for not inviting kids to engagement party to Travis

She also has a degree in International Relations from the University of Cambridge and worked at BBC in the United Kingdom before joining CNN.

Curnow often posts about her life on Instagram, where she has over 8,000 followers.

item.title: I posed NAKED on a holy tree in Bali – now I face six years in jail and a £55k fine under local porn laws
item.dc:creator: Tom Hussey
item.description: A RUSSIAN yoga influencer faces up to six YEARS in jail and a £55,000 fine after posing completely naked for a photo shoot under a sacred tree in Bali. Instagram star Alina Yoga shared pictures of her pushing her boobs up against the tree in Indonesia on her popular social media account. But the saucy […]
item.content:encoded:
A RUSSIAN yoga influencer faces up to six YEARS in jail and a £55,000 fine after posing completely naked for a photo shoot under a sacred tree in Bali.

Instagram star Alina Yoga shared pictures of her pushing her boobs up against the tree in Indonesia on her popular social media account.

But the saucy snaps soon found their way to Balinese entrepreneur Niluh Djelantik who grassed her up and called on the local authorities to intervene.

Djelantik said the Russian beauty had posed naked at the 700-year-old weeping paperbark tree, known locally as kayu putih.

Now the bendy influencer – who has over 16,000 followers on Instagram – could face up to six years in jail if she’s found guilty under local porn laws.

The photos show her perched on the trunk absolutely starkers as she looks cheekily over her shoulder.

Most read in World News

FINAL STAND

Evil Putin VIOLATES ceasefire leaving Ukrainian wounded 'dying in agony'

VLAD'S NHS PLOT

Russian cyber gang vows to cripple UK ventilators after 'hacker' arrest

SCORCHED EARTH

Humiliated Putin is running out of MISSILES in war on Ukraine, say UK chief

RESORT TRAGEDY

Ayia Napa Brit, 26, 'killed mum driving beach buggy high on drink & drugs'

NUKE THREAT

Putin practises NUCLEAR missile strikes in chilling war games on Nato border

LED BY JACKALS

Putin threw us into war like dogs with no training - we've been betrayed

The tree is located at Babakan Temple in Tabananm on the Indonesian paradise island of Bali.

And because the giant tree is considered sacred to locals, the nude images sparked fury.

Fuming Djelantik said immigration officials are now tracking down the naked Russian.

Amid a backlash, Alina deleted the nude snaps from her account and posted a U-turn apology video on May 4.

READ MORE WORLD STORIES

BALI BABE

'World's sexiest athlete' Alica Schmidt sends fans wild in bikini on Bali beach

SWAMP HORROR

Mystery as Brit found dead in Bali swamp after sending haunting final message

The new video – this time showing her fully clothed and praying at the base of the sacred tree – was accompanied by the message: “I apologise to all Balinese and Indonesian people, I regret my actions.”

She went on: “I’m so embarrassed, I didn’t mean to offend you in any way, absolutely no knowledge of this place.

“I just prayed under a tree and went straight to the police station to explain this incident and apologise.”

Tabanan Police spokesperson Ranefli Dian Candra confirmed that Alina had turned herself over to the authorities and that the case will continue to be processed.

But they did not mention what punishment the naked Instagram star is likely to face.

According to reports, Alina could be charged with spreading pornography under the country’s harsh Information and Electronic Transactions Act (ITE).

If convicted of spreading pornography, she could face up to six years in prison or a fine of IDR 1 billion (£55,432).

It follows a similar incident where a Russian porn star wanted by police in Bali after filming herself having SEX on a sacred mountain is in hiding in Russia.

A video clip posted online show Veronika Troshina, 22, with her pet cat in St Petersburg and nearby Gulf of Finland in the Baltic Sea.

Read More on The Sun

CHELLE'S PAIN

Michelle Heaton in tears on Loose Women over rehab letter from husband

SKY DRAMA

RAF jets escorting plane over London sparks panic - but there's an explanation

Cops in Indonesia at the time were tracking down the actress and her boyfriend over a lewd video uploaded to Pornhub which has been viewed 1.2 million times.

The X-rated sequence was reportedly filmed in 2020 on Mount Batur in the tourist island.

Alina said she regretted the nude shoot and vowed not to repeat it[/caption] Flexible Alina now faces a six year prison sentence and a whopping fine[/caption] The Russian is a social media sensation[/caption] Alina has over 16,000 followers on Instagram[/caption]

item.title: Now humiliated Putin is running out of MISSILES in desperate bid to defeat Ukraine, UK armed forces chief tells TalkTV
item.dc:creator: Ethan Singh
item.description: THE head of Britain’s Armed Forces has said that a humiliated Vladimir Putin is running out of missiles trying to defeat Ukraine. Admiral Sir Tony Radakin claimed that the Russian president could be running low on armaments due to firing more than expected on the brave Ukrainians. He also claimed that Russia have now lost […]
item.content:encoded:
THE head of Britain’s Armed Forces has said that a humiliated Vladimir Putin is running out of missiles trying to defeat Ukraine.

Admiral Sir Tony Radakin claimed that the Russian president could be running low on armaments due to firing more than expected on the brave Ukrainians.

Admiral Sir Tony Radakin claimed that Russia have now lost 25 per cent of all its forces in Ukraine[/caption] Sir Tony believes Vladimir Putin is running out of missiles as a result of the Ukraine invasion[/caption]

He also claimed that Russia have now lost 25 per cent of all its forces in Ukraine and are “struggling” to get any momentum in the Donbas region.

It comes after reports that senior figures in the Russian army and security services have become increasingly frustrated with the sickly tyrant’s handling of the deadly war.

Sir Tony believes that Putin underestimated Ukraine before he ordered the initial Russian offensive.

He said to TalkTV: “He potentially has a problem, because the rate of expenditure and the toughness of the fight is totally different to the one that he perceived on the 24th of February. 

Read More in World News

FINAL STAND

Evil Putin VIOLATES ceasefire leaving Ukrainian wounded 'dying in agony'

RESORT TRAGEDY

Ayia Napa Brit, 26, 'killed mum driving beach buggy high on drink & drugs'

“I think there are several wars going on. There’s a tactical, geographical war going on in Ukraine. There’s a logistics war going on, in terms of how do you maintain that rate of expenditure.

“We’re talking severe impact on their armed forces. We’ve had 25% of their forces effectively being taken out – either through people being killed, or through the damage to their battalion tactical groups.” 

And after the Russian invasion has stalled in recent weeks, Sir Tony argued that Putin is under “incredible pressure” to pull off a victory in the Donbas region.

He said: “I think what we’re now seeing is incredible pressure – political pressure and military pressure – for a victory.

Most read in News

HOT HOT HOT!

Scorching 23C May HEATWAVE on cards, Met Office reveals

SAVAGED

HIGH BRAWL

Mass brawl erupts between 30 schoolkids and dad who 'confronted son’s bullies’

PILOT FREAKout

Passengers terrified as untrained pilot forced to turn back mid-flight

“And I think we’ve got to wait and see whether or not doing that in such a rushed manner against a Ukrainian armed forces that are fighting for their country.”

“And that should give all of us encouragement about how this is going to be a tough fight. This is going to be a hard slog.

“You’re seeing the tactical fight, where he’s trying to rush to a tactical victory, and then he’ll push that with his own people”.

The Admiral went on to give his assessment on some home issues, claiming that the “impact of inflation” may lead to fresh defence cuts.

Read More on The Sun

CHELLE'S PAIN

Michelle Heaton in tears on Loose Women over rehab letter from husband

SKY DRAMA

RAF jets escorting plane over London sparks panic - but there's an explanation

He said that this was troublesome at a time when there “might be” a need to increase defence spending.

Sir Tony said: ” That’s a conversation that we need to have in a much bigger way. A taking stock of what is the impact of this? What is the impact of Russia’s aggression?”

“And then if you ask me as a selfish military officer, could we provide more to the nation in terms of its security with additional spending? Then of course, that’s something that I would welcome.”

Russia could well be running out of missiles and armaments because of how much his forces have had to fire[/caption]

item.title: Brit, 26, ‘ran down and killed Swedish mum while high on drink and drugs’ driving a rented beach buggy in Ayia Napa
item.dc:creator: Adrian Zorzut
item.description: A BRIT allegedly ran down and killed a mum in beach buggy he was driving while four times over the booze limit, police say. Warsmeh Sayd, 26, was named in a police appeal after allegedly fleeing the crash scene on foot in Ayia Napa, Cyprus. When he was arrested later on Wednesday evening, he failed […]
item.content:encoded:
A BRIT allegedly ran down and killed a mum in beach buggy he was driving while four times over the booze limit, police say.

Warsmeh Sayd, 26, was named in a police appeal after allegedly fleeing the crash scene on foot in Ayia Napa, Cyprus.

Warsmeh Sayd was named in a police appeal before his arrest[/caption]

When he was arrested later on Wednesday evening, he failed a breathalyser and also had cannabis in his system, police said.

The victim was named as Camilla Christina Pamdahl, 46, from Sweden, who was on holiday with her five-year-old daughter.

Reports said Camilla had left the child with a babysitter at her hotel so she could go shopping.

She was hit on a pedestrian crossing in the resort at around 5.30pm.

MORE ON CYRPUS

HOLIDAY HORROR

I could be paralysed for LIFE after catching rare disease on trip to Cyprus

'MERCY KILLING'

Brit ‘killed wife after cancer diagnosis as he didn’t want her to suffer’

It was claimed a car had stopped to let her cross when the rented buggy zoomed past it and ploughed into her.

“A young man driving the rental buggy overtook a stopped car, and hit the woman,” police said.

Camilla was taken to hospital in Famagusta but could not be saved.

Social workers and a child psychologist were looking after the victim’s young daughter until her father arrived on the island.

HARD PASS

Police told KNEWS neither the Brit driver or his passenger were injured in the incident.

The passenger stayed at the scene but the driver ran away.

The Brit’s photo was released to local media and an arrest warrant was issued.

He was tracked down hours later and hauled in front of a judge today.

He was ordered to be held in custody for six days as the investigation continues.

Ayia Napa is a popular tourist spot for Brits[/caption]

item.title: Terrifying moment dad shoots cigarette held in son’s MOUTH with an AK-47
item.dc:creator: Jacob Bentley-York
item.description: TERRIFYING video shows a dad shooting a cigarette out of his son’s mouth with an AK-47. The horrifying clip, said to be filmed in southern Iraq, showed the unidentified father as he used the child as target practice. According to reports, the man – from the governorate of Al Muthanna – told his son to […]
item.content:encoded:
TERRIFYING video shows a dad shooting a cigarette out of his son’s mouth with an AK-47.

The horrifying clip, said to be filmed in southern Iraq, showed the unidentified father as he used the child as target practice.

The young boy was filmed as his father shot a cigarette out of his mouth[/caption] Calls have grown for the dad to be investigated after the terrifying footage emerged online[/caption]

According to reports, the man – from the governorate of Al Muthanna – told his son to hold the cigarette in his mouth so he could show off his sniping skills.

In the video, the boy is seen standing in front of the camera with his chin raised and the cigarette thrust up into the sky from his mouth.

Meanwhile, his dad walks towards the far end of the courtyard with a rifle in his hand before taking a sitting position on the ground.

He takes aim as his son tries to remain as still as possible before pulling the trigger.

The stunned youngster flinches at the noise and then removes the ciggie from his mouth, showing it to the camera before his dad brags about his accuracy.

After the video was widely shared online, social media users expressed their horror and called on local authorities to take action, with some claiming it should be treated as attempted murder.

The calls come just five years after a bungling sharpshooter attempting a similarly gruesome experiment as he tried to hit a cigarette out of a woman’s hand.

Footage showed the relaxed “assistant” holding a lit cig between her digits as a target for his rifle.

Most read in News

PILOT FREAKout

But the gunslinger’s 22 pellet, fired from close range, appeared to hit the woman’s fingers and left her screaming and covered in blood.

In 2018, a wrongly calculated YouTube prank proved fatal when a woman shot her boyfriend dead in front of their three-year-old daughter in a stunt they hoped would go viral.

Monalisa Perez believed partner Pedro Ruiz would be shielded by a thick book as she blasted him from close range.

However, after shooting her boyfriend with a Desert Eagle pistol, described as “one of the world’s most powerful semiautomatic handguns,” he tragically died on the spot.  

At the time, Perez told a sheriff’s deputy that it was Ruiz who had been pushing his idea for the video, which was recorded by one camera on the back of a parked vehicle and another on a ladder.

Read More on The Sun

CHELLE'S PAIN

Michelle Heaton in tears on Loose Women over rehab letter from husband

SKY DRAMA

RAF jets escorting plane over London sparks panic - but there's an explanation

He had shown Perez another book he had shot and how the bullet had not gone all the way through.

Perez pleaded guilty to second-degree manslaughter and was jailed for six months.

item.title: British woman, 80, found shot dead in her Costa Blanca home as ‘couple arrested over murder’
item.dc:creator: Amelia Beltrao
item.description: A BRITISH pensioner has been shot dead in her Costa Blanca home near Elche. Police have reportedly arrested a couple on suspicion of shooting the 80-year-old woman. The victim’s body was discovered just after 6.30pm on Wednesday after police were called to the property in Elche near Alicante. The detainees have been described as a […]
item.content:encoded:
A BRITISH pensioner has been shot dead in her Costa Blanca home near Elche.

Police have reportedly arrested a couple on suspicion of shooting the 80-year-old woman.

A British woman was found shot dead in her Costa Blanca home[/caption]

The victim’s body was discovered just after 6.30pm on Wednesday after police were called to the property in Elche near Alicante.

The detainees have been described as a man and woman thought to have been seen leaving the murder victim’s villa by a plumber who had been called to the property to do an urgent repair job.

The possible motive for the crime has not been revealed.

Detectives said the death is being treated as murder.

Read more Crime stories

POISON PEN

Chilling details in anonymous letter lead cops to girlfriend of murdered man

BABY HORROR

Parents warning as car thief throws baby out of window before stealing motor

Local reports said the unnamed woman had been at her home on a residential estate called Urbanizacion Torre Azul between Elche and the nearby town of Torrellano.

Police are understood to have increased patrols in the area and the property has been cordoned with police tape.

Worried neighbours are thought to have called police when they found her body after a plumber went round for an arranged visit and got no answer when he knocked on the front door.

Well-placed sources have said the victim had lived alone for several years after the death of her husband.
